metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23308 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
valid.c in libxml2 before 2.9.13 has a use-after-free of ID and IDREFattributes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23308` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.13+esm3
libxml2-utils - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.13+esm3
python-libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.13+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.13+esm3').
